results.title: Temperature regulation
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Medi-Cine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”
Animation is used in part to demonstrate the cooling mechanisms in the body, and techniques such as thermography are also used.

results.title: The Stream of life
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”
Designed for 11 to 14 year olds, the film illustrates the bloodstream and its functions, using resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory. Uses clinical techniques, anatomical models and preparations selected to demonstrate body functions.
results.description:

results.title: The Skin as a sense organ
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Human beings have seven senses of the skin that provide information about the outside world. Looking beneath the skin with a microscope reveals that each sense may be associated with a different type of nerve ending.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.

results.brief_description:

results.title: The Lymphatic system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Animation and live photography are used to demonstrate blood flow in the capillary system and investigate the nature of the lymphatic system. No other credits available.

Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
This film uses resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory to show aspects of anatomy and physiology. This film in the series shows the body’s enemies and how the body defends itself.
